definition: empty hand, empty fist (idiom); having nothing to rely on/unarmed and defenseless
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: An ex post facto law prohibits the use of guns by individuals against unarmed persons trespassing on their property.
sentences.chinese: 事後法阻止個人對赤手空拳的財產侵犯者使用槍支。

sentences.english: How can you be a hero if you are unarmed?
sentences.chinese: 你就這樣赤手空拳的，怎麼當英雄啊？

sentences.english: In the uprising the serfs fought with bare hands against gunfire.
sentences.chinese: 在暴動中，農奴們以赤手空拳對付鋼槍鐵炮。

sentences.english: You don't need a sword. You've still got your fist.
sentences.chinese: 不一定要用刀，赤手空拳也能殺人。

sentences.english: They attacked  him with their bare hands.
sentences.chinese: 他們赤手空拳地攻擊他。

sentences.english: Bare hands just will not do the job.
sentences.chinese: 赤手空拳不能做這些事情。

sentences.english: Her barehanded whether come true from commonplace to the success perfect very quickly?
sentences.chinese: 赤手空拳的她能否實現從平庸到成功的完美一躍？

sentences.english: The masses held off the aggressors with their hands.
sentences.chinese: 人羣赤手空拳地抗擊侵略者。

sentences.english: Does our bare hand deal with Long Wang?
sentences.chinese: 難道我們赤手空拳去對付龍王？

sentences.english: The policeman smote the hoodlums with his bare fist.
sentences.chinese: 警察赤手空拳打這些無賴。

sentences.english: The famous boxer killed a fierce wolf with his bare hands.
sentences.chinese: 那位著名的拳擊師赤手空拳打死了一頭兇猛的惡狼。

definition: empty-handed/unarmed/(painting, embroidery etc) without following a model/(abbr. for 空手道[kong1 shou3 dao4]) karate
lit. not an inch of steel (idiom); unarmed and defenseless
lit. lacking the strength even to truss a chicken (idiom)/fig. weak/unaccustomed to physical work
pinyin: shou3 wu2 fu4 ji1 zhi1 li4

definition: many men, a great force (idiom); many hands provide great strength/There is safety in numbers.
